intro: Cyrtomium devexiscapulae, commonly known as the narrow-sheathed holly fern, is a species of evergreen fern native to the mountainous regions of southeastern China. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its compact, dense foliage and distinctive, narrow, leathery fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often on rocky or forested slopes. Its spores are produced in clusters on the undersides of the fronds, and it is valued for its ornamental appearance in horticulture. Cyrtomium devexiscapulae is relatively low-maintenance and thrives in USDA hardiness zones 6 through 9.
